column3: Amy believes the soap bottle is empty.
column4: Amy believes the soap bottle is full.

column1: Daisy was at the park, ready to play. Daisy wanted to fly her kite high in the sky. The kite was light.
column2: Does Daisy think the kite is light or heavy?
column3: Daisy believes the kite is heavy.
column4: Daisy believes the kite is light.

column1: Carl was at a fun fair, standing in front of a game booth. Carl wanted to win a big fat teddy bear. The teddy bear was hanging on a very stable hook.
column2: Does Carl think the teddy bear is hanging on a stable hook or a shaky hook?
column3: Carl believes the teddy bear is hanging on a shaky hook.
column4: Carl believes the teddy bear is hanging on a stable hook.

column1: Ben was in the library, looking for a book about the world. Ben wanted to find a big map of the world to display in his room. The world map in the library was complete.
column2: Does Ben think the world map is complete or incomplete?
column3: Ben believes the world map is incomplete.
column4: Ben believes the world map is complete.

column1: Will was in the zoo, looking at the leopards. Will wanted to see the big leopard lay down to sleep. The leopard's bed was empty.
column2: Does Will think the leopard's bed is empty or has a pillow?
column3: Will believes the leopard's bed has a pillow.
column4: Will believes the leopard's bed is empty.

column1: Ingrid was in her garage, ready to fix her unique bike. Ingrid wanted to oil the bike's pedal. The pedal was rusty.
column2: Does Ingrid think the pedal is rusty or clean?
column3: Ingrid believes the pedal is clean.
column4: Ingrid believes the pedal is rusty.

column1: Ben was at the park, flying his new kite. Ben wanted to show his kite to his friend, who was a pilot. The kite was strong and firm.
column2: Does Ben think his kite is strong and firm or crumpled?
column3: Ben believes his kite is crumpled.
column4: Ben believes his kite is strong and firm.

column1: Ula was in the park, ready to play with her friends. Ula wanted to win the game of tag. The juice box she brought was full.
column2: Does Ula think the juice box is full or spilled?
column3: Ula believes the juice box is spilled.
column4: Ula believes the juice box is full.

column1: Sam was in the park, sitting on a bench. Sam wanted to fly his new kite. The kite string was untied.
column2: Does Sam think the kite string is untied or knotted?
column3: Sam believes the kite string is knotted.
column4: Sam believes the kite string is untied.

column1: Dora was at school, in her messy art class. Dora wanted to teach her friends how to make a big clay pot. The lump of clay was big.
column2: Does Dora think the lump of clay is big or small?
column3: Dora believes the lump of clay is small.
column4: Dora believes the lump of clay is big.

column1: Vera was in the forest, looking for a special tree. Vera wanted to find the tree with the brightest leaves. The forest was very bright.
column2: Does Vera think the forest is bright or dim?
column3: Vera believes the forest is dim.
column4: Vera believes the forest is bright.

column1: Finn was at the park, playing with his kite. Finn wanted to fly his kite high in the sky. The kite's string was tangled.
column2: Does Finn think the kite's string is tangled or untangled?
column3: Finn believes the kite's string is untangled.
column4: Finn believes the kite's string is tangled.

column1: Xander was in the art room, ready to draw a picture. Xander wanted to draw a bald eagle. His pen was clean.
column2: Does Xander think the pen is clean or dirty?
column3: Xander believes the pen is dirty.
column4: Xander believes the pen is clean.

column1: Carl was at the park, looking at the street from a bench. Carl wanted to watch the interesting cars pass by. The street was busy with cars.
column2: Does Carl think the street is busy with cars or empty of cars?
column3: Carl believes the street is empty of cars.
column4: Carl believes the street is busy with cars.

column1: Fiona was at the park, watching the pigeons. Fiona wanted to feed the pigeons with the big bag of bird food she brought. The bag of bird food was full.
column2: Does Fiona think the bag of bird food is full or not full?
column3: Fiona believes the bag of bird food is not full.
column4: Fiona believes the bag of bird food is full.

column1: Rita was in the barn, feeding the horses. Rita wanted to give a big pile of hay to each horse. The hay pile was big.
column2: Does Rita think the hay pile is big or scattered?
column3: Rita believes the hay pile is scattered.
column4: Rita believes the hay pile is big.

column1: Lily was in the park, playing hide and seek with her friends. Lily wanted to find a good hiding spot. The big tree had lots of leaves and looked like a good hiding spot.
column2: Does Lily think the big tree is a good hiding spot or not?
column3: Lily believes the big tree is not a good hiding spot.
column4: Lily believes the big tree is a good hiding spot.

column1: Ina was in the park, playing on the swing. Ina wanted to swing high and touch the sky. The swing was straight and steady.
column2: Does Ina think the swing is straight and steady or twisted?
column3: Ina believes the swing is twisted.
column4: Ina believes the swing is straight and steady.

column1: Rose was at the park, looking at the brilliant hot air balloon. Rose wished to ride the hot air balloon. The hot air balloon was inflated and ready to go.
column2: Does Rose think the hot air balloon is inflated and ready to go or not?
column3: Rose believes the hot air balloon is not fully inflated.
column4: Rose believes the hot air balloon is inflated and ready to go.

column1: Ben was at the farm, picking fresh vegetables. Ben wanted to find a rare red onion. The onion looked white.
column2: Does Ben think the onion is white or red?
column3: Ben believes the onion is red.
column4: Ben believes the onion is white.

column1: Sally was at the zoo, looking at the rhinoceros. Sally wanted to take a picture of the rhinoceros when it was relaxing. The rhinoceros was standing up.
column2: Does Sally think the rhinoceros is standing or sitting?
column3: Sally believes the rhinoceros is sitting.
column4: Sally believes the rhinoceros is standing.
